intro: Matelea romeroi, commonly known as the desert matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along desert margins. Matelea romeroi is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to three feet, with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves.
